Lack of specific details: The expert mentions that the accompanying text of the photographs typically does not provide specific details such as time and place. This lack of specific information makes it difficult to verify the authenticity of the claim.
Varying attributions: The expert notes that similar reports of dog rescues of abandoned children have appeared in the news media over the years, but none of them seem to be related to the specific photographs in question. The claim has been attributed to multiple, widely varying parts of the world, further complicating the verification process.
Uncertain source: The most common version of the claim suggests that it occurred somewhere in or around Saudi Arabia, as reported by the Saudi publication Sada. However, the expert highlights that it is unclear whether the incident actually took place in Saudi Arabia or another country. The uncertainty surrounding the source adds to the challenge of verifying the claim.
Staging possibility: The expert points out that it is still unknown whether the photographs are authentic or if they capture something that was staged. Without concrete evidence or additional information, it is difficult to determine the authenticity of the claim.
